availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1862-1863

body.p:
State of Kentucky
Taylor County Sct
Decr Term 1862

It appearing to the Court that John G Newcomer a justice of the peace in district No 3 in Taylor County Kentucky has departed this life, R. E. Jeter is therefore recommended to his excellency the Governor of Kentucky as a suitable person to fill the vacancy occasioned by the death of said Newcomer --

A Copy att
Geo. W. Montague clk
Taylor County Court

It appearing to the Court that Jno R. Robinson Notary public for Taylor County is now absent from said County acting as Captain in the United States Army, Robt S Montague is recommended to his excelency the Governor of Kentucky as a suitable person to fill the office of Notary Public for said County --

A Copy Att
Geo. W. Montague clk
Taylor County Court

Taylor Co
J. P. Dist No 3.
R. E. Jeter
Notary
R. S. Montague
Appd made Dec 6. 1862
